senses.de: To keep safe from harm or danger
senses.ex: Wear your helmet to protect your head while riding a bike.

Tips.title: Physical Safety
Tips.description: Often used when advising measures to prevent physical harm or injury.
Tips.example: Protect your feet by wearing shoes on hot sand.

Tips.title: Emotional Nuance
Tips.description: Sometimes implies care or love towards what is being protected.
Tips.example: She protected her children from the bad news.

senses.de: To legally ensure that a certain right is respected
senses.ex: The law is designed to protect consumer interests.

Tips.title: Legal Context
Tips.description: Used in contexts involving laws, regulations, or rights.
Tips.example: The legislation protects employees from unfair dismissal.

Tips.title: Formal Language
Tips.description: Common in formal or official discussions about rights and laws.
Tips.example: The contract protects our right to intellectual property.

senses.de: To create a barrier that prevents something from damage
senses.ex: Use sunscreen to protect your skin from the sun.

Tips.title: Barrier Creation
Tips.description: Used when talking about putting up defenses, literally or metaphorically.
Tips.example: They built a fence to protect their crops from pests.

Tips.title: Proactive Measure
Tips.description: Suggests taking action before harm can occur.
Tips.example: Protect your health by getting vaccinated.

senses.de: To prevent from being damaged by actions or decisions
senses.ex: The city walls were built to protect the citizens from invaders.

Tips.title: Historical Uses
Tips.description: Associated with fortifying locations against ancient threats.
Tips.example: Moats were used to protect castles in medieval times.

Tips.title: Protection Scale
Tips.description: Can refer to individual or large-scale defensive actions.
Tips.example: The army was deployed to protect the country's borders.

senses.de: To maintain the confidentiality or integrity of data
senses.ex: We use encryption to protect customers' personal data.

Tips.title: Digital Security
Tips.description: Used in the context of safeguarding information in the digital world.
Tips.example: Antivirus software helps protect your computer from viruses.

Tips.title: Privacy Importance
Tips.description: Highlights the aspect of keeping personal or sensitive information safe.
Tips.example: Protect your privacy by using secure passwords.

Conserve.wordDefinition:
Conserve means to save something from being wasted or destroyed by using it carefully and protecting it for the future.

This word applies when we want to keep something in good condition and prevent it from being lost or destroyed, such as conserving water or energy.

Conserve is used when we want to prevent something from being wasted or destroyed, while protect is used when we want to keep something safe from harm or danger.

Cover.wordDefinition:
Cover means to place something over another thing, often to conceal or hide it. For example, a book cover is put over a book to protect it from damage or dirt.

The main difference between the two is that cover is putting something on top of another thing while protect is doing something to keep something else safe.

Defend.wordDefinition:
Both defend and protect refer to preventing harm or danger to someone or something, but there is a subtle difference between them.

Defend means to resist or fight against an attack or criticism. It suggests a more active and aggressive stance, as you are taking action to stop something from happening.

For example, a football team defends their goal from the opposing team's attack, or a lawyer could defend a client in court against accusations.

Defend is used when you need to actively fight against something harmful, while protect is used when you want to prevent something harmful from happening.

Guard.wordDefinition:
Guard means to keep watch over something or someone, to prevent harm or danger. For example, a security guard who watches over a building to prevent theft or break-ins.

In summary, guarding is about keeping vigilant and watching for danger, while protecting is about taking an action to keep something or someone safe.

Preserve.wordDefinition:
Preserve means to keep something in its original form, to maintain or conserve it, while protect means to keep something or someone safe from harm or damage.

Preserve is applicable when we want to maintain or conserve something from deteriorating or changing its original form.

For example, we preserve food to prevent spoilage, we preserve historical monuments and artifacts to protect them from damage or destruction, and we preserve traditions to keep them alive for future generations.

Preserve means to maintain or conserve something, while protect means to keep something safe from harm or danger.

Secure.wordDefinition:
Secure means to make something safe from theft or unauthorized access.

It is often used to describe digital information, like passwords and credit card information. For example, a strong password secures your online accounts from hackers.

Both words are applicable in different situations, but the key difference is that protect is about preventing harm, while secure is about preventing theft or unauthorized access.

Shelter.wordDefinition:
Shelter means to provide a place of safety, usually to protect from the elements such as wind, rain, or sun.

For example, a homeless person might seek shelter in a doorway to protect themselves from the rain.

Protect is used when talking about preventing harm or danger, while shelter is used when talking about providing a safe place to protect from the elements.

Shield.wordDefinition:
Both protect and shield refer to the act of keeping something or someone safe.

However, protect usually refers to preventing harm from happening, while shield refers to stopping harm that is already happening.

For instance, you protect your skin from getting sunburnt by wearing sunscreen while you are outside. But if you are getting hit with a thrown ball, you would use a shield (like your hands) to prevent the ball from hitting you.

Protect is applicable when you want to keep something safe from potential harm, while shield is applicable when you want to stop harm from continuing.

quotes.Text: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Ronald Reagan

quotes.Text: Especially when you have a lot of technology you're developing as a small company, trying to protect that technology is a real problem.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: Lonnie Johnson

quotes.Text: When you are in the public eye, you have to protect yourself. There are so many people judging you. I just try to be myself.
quotes.Title: American Tennis Player
quotes.Name: Venus Williams

quotes.Text: I feel I have to protect myself against things. So I'm pretty careful to lose most of them.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Orson Welles

quotes.Text: You have to protect yourself at all times. What goes around comes around.
quotes.Title: American Boxer
quotes.Name: Floyd Mayweather, Jr.

quotes.Text: Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Mae West

quotes.Text: Around every corner, always protect the engine that powers you.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Dwayne Johnson

quotes.Text: A good lawyer is going to try to protect her client.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: John Kennedy

quotes.Text: If you've got a talent, protect it.
quotes.Title: Canadian Comedian
quotes.Name: Jim Carrey

quotes.Text: Your silence will not protect you.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Audre Lorde
